meta_description: Grant Cottage State Historic Site is the final home of Ulysses S. Grant. He spent his final weeks here with his family before he completed his memoirs and died in 1885. Visitors can tour the historic house museum between Memorial Day and Columbus Day.
hours_text:
# The Historic Site is Closed for the Season

### **See You in May 2026!**

**Note: There is no public access to the historic site grounds until May 2026.**

* * *

# [Admission](https://fareharbor.com/embeds/book/grantcottage/items/331641/?flow=206035&full-items=yes)

[ Book your tour now! ](https://fareharbor.com/embeds/book/grantcottage/?full-items=yes)

# Tours of the Cottage****

[Entrance to the Cottage interior is by guided Tour only.](https://fareharbor.com/embeds/book/grantcottage/?from-ssl=yes&full-items=yes&ga=UA-73017800-1%2C2008263858.1583867704%3B&u=3f107217-7a70-4855-ae61-2d562804d6b4)

[**Reserving your Tour PRIOR to your visit**](https://fareharbor.com/embeds/book/grantcottage/?full-items=yes)**is highly recommended.**

**_Tours MUST arrive 15 minutes prior to their start time._**_Tours run every 30 minutes._**_Last Tour of the day begins promptly at 3:30pm._**

Adults: $12

Seniors (62 & up): $9

Ages 17 & under: $5

Children under 6: FREE

[Members](https://www.grantcottage.org/membership): FREE

Veterans/Active Military/Gold Star Family Members: FREE w/ I.D. 

[**Living History Tours**](https://fareharbor.com/embeds/book/grantcottage/items/331641/?flow=206035&full-items=yes): $18 per person.__**Available Friday, & Sunday at 3:30pm*.__ Extended Tour of Grant Cottage with a guide in 1885 period dress and character. (***Tours are subject to staff availability).

[**Private Tours**](https://fareharbor.com/embeds/book/grantcottage/?from-ssl=yes&full-items=yes&g...

collections_text:
### Celebrating the Life of 

### Julia Boggs _Dent_ Grant

### In the 200th Anniversary Year of Her Birth 

### 1826-2026

* * *

# Bring Grant Cottage to you!

# Explore our Outreach Programs

 _(Available Year-Round.)_

[ Learn More ](https://www.grantcottage.org/outreach)

# **FREE Online Content!**

[ Presentation videos ](/multimedia)

[ Historical Articles ](/blog)

* * *

**_The Overlook at Grant Cottage gives a panoramic view of the grounds of the Revolutionary War_** _,_**__**_including an interpretive panel. Ulysses Grant often enjoyed the view from the_** _overlook_** _which now has a memorial in his honor. No doubt President Grant knew this very spot changed the course of America. Access to the_** _overlook_** _, site grounds and walking trails, interpretive panels, audio app grounds tour, and visitor center with exhibits and a gift shop are FREE to the public anytime the site is open._

[ ](https://www.saratoga250.com)

# The Historic Site is temporarily CLOSED through April 2026.

Sponsorship Opportunities

**Support our 2026 programs and site improvements!** Learn how you or your business can support The Friends of the Ulysses S. Grant Cottage, historic preservation, and learning by becoming a Sponsor.

[More Info](https://www.grantcottage.org/take-action)
